subject: Investing
title: Reading a Stock Quote
description: A short lesson to help you apply Reading a Stock Quote.

hook.text: AAPL: $178.72 +2.31 (+1.31%). Those numbers tell a story if you know how to read them.

buildup.text: The ticker symbol is the stock's shorthand name. The price is the last traded amount per share.

discovery.text: The change shows how much the price moved today. Green means up, red means down. Percentage gives context.

twist.text: A $2 move on a $10 stock is huge. The same $2 on a $500 stock is noise. Always check the percentage.

climax.text: Volume tells you how many shares traded today. High volume confirms conviction. Low volume means thin interest.

punchline.text: A stock quote is a snapshot. Learn to read the whole picture.

quiz.question: Why is the percentage change more useful than the dollar change?
options: It gives context relative to the stock's price
